    • createMissingConverters

      public static void createMissingConverters()
      Adds all possible ChainedConverters to the current converters

    • convert

      public static <F, T> Optional<? extends T> convert(@Nullable F o, Class<T> to)
      Converts the given value to the desired type. If you want to convert multiple values of the same type you should use getConverter(Class, Class) to get a converter to convert the values.
      Parameters:
      o - the value to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      the converted value or null if no converter exists or the converter returned null for the given value.

    • convert

      public static <F, T> Optional<? extends T> convert(@Nullable F o, Class<? extends T>[] to)
      Converts an object into one of the given types. This method does not convert the object if it is already an instance of any of the given classes.
      Parameters:
      o - the value to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      the converted value

    • convertArray

      public static <T> Optional<T[]> convertArray(@Nullable @Nullable Object[] o, Class<T> to)
      Converts all entries in the given array to the desired type, using convert(Object, Class) to convert every single value. If you want to convert an array of values of a known type, consider using convert(Object[], Class, Function) for much better performance.
      Parameters:
      o - the values to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      a T[] array without null elements

    • convertArray

      public static <T> T[] convertArray(@Nullable @Nullable Object[] o, Class<? extends T> to, Class<T> superType)
      Converts multiple objects into any of the given classes.
      Parameters:
      o - the values to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      superType - The component type of the returned array
      Returns:
      the converted array

    • converterExists

      public static boolean converterExists(Class<?> from, Class<?> to)
      Tests whether a converter between the given classes exists.
      Parameters:
      from - the class to convert from
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      whether a converter exists

    • converterExists

      public static boolean converterExists(Class<?> from, Class<?>... to)
      Tests whether a converter between one of the given classes exists
      Parameters:
      from - the class to convert from
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      whether a converter exists

    • getConverter

      public static <F, T> Optional<? extends Function<? super F,Optional<? extends T>>> getConverter(Class<F> from, Class<T> to)
      Gets a converter
      Parameters:
      from - the class to convert from
      to - the class to convert to
      Returns:
      the converter or null if none exist

    • convertUnsafe

      public static <F, T> T[] convertUnsafe(F[] from, Class<?> to, Function<? super F,Optional<? extends T>> converter)
      Converts a given array without checking the type.
      Parameters:
      from - the values to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      converter - the converter function
      Returns:
      the converted values
      Throws:
      ArrayStoreException - if the given class is not a superclass of all objects returned by the converter

    • convert

      public static <F, T> T[] convert(F[] from, Class<T> to, Function<? super F,Optional<? extends T>> converter)
      Converts a given array.
      Parameters:
      from - the values to convert
      to - the class to convert to
      converter - the converter function
      Returns:
      the converted values
